benchmark_details.name: CACTUS (CBT-augmented Counseling ChatCorpus)
benchmark_details.overview: CACTUS is a multi-turn dialogue dataset that emulates real-life interactions using the goal-oriented and structured approach of Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT). It captures the depth and flow of psychological counseling by designing client personas and applying CBT techniques in discussions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset to train open-source language models as effective counseling agents by simulating real-life psychological counseling conversations.

data.source: Synthetic data generated using personas, thoughts, and patterns from the PatternReframe dataset.
data.annotation: Manual curation and automated generation based on psychological principles.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on manual evaluation and specific scaling for counseling dialogue criteria.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in engagement and therapeutic quality.
methodology.validation: Human evaluations conducted with experts and through Amazon Mechanical Turk.

harm: Potential for misrepresentation of mental health advice

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data is synthesized and does not include real client information; ethical standards for data use are followed.
